title:
Advancements in Signal Processing and Control Systems Using Z and
  L-Transforms
authors:
A.Jeeva, Vijayabalan D, Maria Singaraj Rosary, Nasir Ali, and Fikadu
  Tesgera Tolasa
abstract:
To excel in signal processing or control systems, a deep understanding of
transforms is essential. But what exactly is this mathematical tool, and how
does it function? In this article, we will explore the fundamentals of
transforms, their properties, and their applications. Let's dive into one of
the key concepts of modern signal processing. Additionally, we will discuss
Z-transforms and integrated Z-transforms, highlighting their roles in signal
processing. Moreover, to demonstrate the practical application of transforms,
we will introduce a novel concept involving fuzzy random variables.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Signal Processing
